results.content: If you want to get Django under your belt you really need to just start writing Django based projects. This course took me through enough projects, explaining the hows and whys along the way, to give me the confidence needed to push forward on bigger projects of my own.
results.content_html: If you want to get Django under your belt you really need to just start writing Django based projects. This course took me through enough projects, explaining the hows and whys along the way, to give me the confidence needed to push forward on bigger projects of my own.

results.content:
The examples are chosen well. They teach basics about Django. Instructor explains the code and function of the code segments. Template overriding could be mentioned and explained instead of writing same html over and over. 
Also it would be more understandable if functions (adding, deleting, admin access, etc) were to be added gradually and result is demonstrated each time. All code is written at once and all functionality is demonstrated at once. It is up to us, to match the code part and functionality when the code is being written.
results.content_html:

Also it would be more understandable if functions (adding, deleting, admin access, etc) were to be added gradually and result is demonstrated each time. All code is written at once and all functionality is demonstrated at once. It is up to us, to match the code part and functionality when the code is being written.

results.content: This is a very well structured course wich teach you step by step.This course is a great value with lots of clear explanations.Really good tutorial, going to the point about what is important to learn.
results.content_html: This is a very well structured course wich teach you step by step.This course is a great value with lots of clear explanations.Really good tutorial, going to the point about what is important to learn.

results.content:
I found that some of the material content was missing from some of the videos. For instance the last project omitted the steps of creating  the views required for the app but after you download the actual example project you can note the differences that were excluded in the video demonstration. 

So in essence if you were to follow the video you may find that some of the project do not work no matter how many time you review the video. Luckily for me I had a background in Django that help prepared me. Adding to this thankfully the author provided the final working project for download.

However if you want to test your knowledge in some of django features go ahead and buy this course.

results.content: The course itself is very informative and the instructor is engaging. However, I'm afraid the course materials are not up-to-date with the newer versions of Django. Also, even when I email for support, they still haven't responded after 13 days. However, to end on a positive note, the course itself is very well organized.

Also, even when I email for support, they still haven't responded after 13 days. However, to end on a positive note, the course itself is very well organized.

results.content: pretty good, but I think this lecture need to update with new django version.
results.content_html: pretty good, but I think this lecture need to update with new django version.

results.content: full of inconsistencies from the first lesson. Guy will say you should use a certain editor, then randomly bust out sublime text. Will start working on files before telling you where they go, which is not fun when you are a cli user. If I wanted to learn django from an amateur reading a book, I could have saved myself the time and headache and just done lessons from a book. But... at least you aren't terribly out of date... oh wait.

results.content: The course is basically just a walkthrough. There isn't any explanation of what is going on and some of the projects contains code that doesn't work.
results.content_html: The course is basically just a walkthrough. There isn't any explanation of what is going on and some of the projects contains code that doesn't work.

results.content: Though I only did the 1st project, I'm pretty sure I won't do the rest. There are too many small and important steps missed in the videos. And the presentation goes back and forth from Eclipse and Sublime Text editors. It's like watching a video zoom back and forth from 50% to 200%. The whole set of videos should be at the same relative font size so I don't have to keep zooming back and forth just because the instructor desires to switches editors between python editing and django template editing (which in itself is kind of annoying.) Odd break in lectures too... a lecture might break off in the middle of an explanation for no reason, only to pick it back up on the next lecture. It makes planning for a set amount of study time impossible. But the only saving grace is that the instructors final product, which works and has all the code that somehow got missed in the videos, so you can compare what you have tried to follow along with to his final product and find the missing pieces.

results.content: Very well made course! Covers basics as well as some more advanced stuff and the fact, that you build while watching the lectures makes the learning so much more efficient.
results.content_html: Very well made course! Covers basics as well as some more advanced stuff and the fact, that you build while watching the lectures makes the learning so much more efficient.

results.content: This courses is top rated. The best part is live instruction, with playback. Great instructions. they are always there to answer questions, and prompt when you open an issue if you are having any trouble. you get lifetime access to the course you took!!! People looking to get their feet wet with django python programming should definitely take this course. Very well planned, easy to understand and follow, by the end you get a really good understanding of the fundamentals, if you are coming with a background in another programming language, this course will allow you to quickly get up to speed with a new, popular and useful language.

results.content: So far the content was good, but the presenter's screen is absolutely unreadable due to the small font, dark background, and him not zooming in to where he is actually working (like most other presenters do).

results.content:
This course really didn't teach me how to understand compiling applications between Django and python together and really it felt more like I just paid for overpriced instructions on setting up a django environment variable to which if I downloaded the instructors pre-built applications and followed his verbal instruction to configure it for view -- granted a ton of open sourced security issues on my local machine.

 For instances; I have no idea why I would want host an image share application that directly store the images from my local directory.
For instance again: I have no idea why I would want to build a cms blog site that offers no means to configure admin or deal with upload and monitoring of source code ... yes I understand its' simple ... but does simple have to be sand trap stupid?  

Really I would like a refund -- but since 30 days have passed i'm out of luck.

Save your money and take the php-mysql course instead !
results.content_html:

For instances; I have no idea why I would want host an image share application that directly store the images from my local directory.
For instance again: I have no idea why I would want to build a cms blog site that offers no means to configure admin or deal with upload and monitoring of source code ... yes I understand its' simple ... but does simple have to be sand trap stupid?
